event.title: was established as a village in 1924

data.event: Alameda was established as a village in 1924 at the consolidation of the villages of Fairview and North Pocatello which were platted on the northern boundary of the town of Pocatello in 1911 and 1914 respectively.

event.title: were platted on the northern boundary of the town of Pocatello in 1911

data.event: Alameda was established as a village in 1924 at the consolidation of the villages of Fairview and North Pocatello which were platted on the northern boundary of the town of Pocatello in 1911 and 1914 respectively.
By 1930 the village exceeded its predessor villages' 1920 population by 144%.

event.title: 40 years of history, the village became

data.event: In just under 40 years of history, the village became Idaho's 11th most populous City.
It was consolidated with Pocatello in 1962 with the support of its mayor, George V. Hansen.
